DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Concurrent Medication : Allowed : Antidiarrheal compound ( dose remain stable ) . Zidovudine ( AZT ) , dideoxyinosine ( ddI ) , dideoxycytidine ( ddC ) , alternative HIV therapy ( provide dose stable least 4 week prior study entry ) . Patients must : AIDS . Cryptosporidium parvum enteritis . Chronic diarrhea . Life expectancy least 4 week . Ability tolerate food mouth . Ability take histamine H2receptor antagonist famotidine ( Pepcid ) . Prior Medication : Allowed : Antidiarrheal compound ( provide dose remain stable 7 day prior study entry ) . Zidovudine ( AZT ) , dideoxyinosine ( ddI ) , dideoxycytidine ( ddC ) , alternative HIV therapy ( provide dose remained stable least 4 week prior study entry ) . Exclusion Criteria Coexisting Condition : Patients follow symptoms condition exclude : Concurrent unresolved clinical infection enteric pathogen C. parvum ( e.g. , rotavirus , Salmonella , Shigella , Campylobacter , Giardia , C. difficile toxin , Yersinia , amebiasis , MAI , CMV , Microsporida ) determine history routine microbiology screening . Other acute infection concurrent immediately lifethreatening medical crisis cryptosporidiosis . Grossly bloody diarrhea . Known allergy milk milk product ( lactose intolerance ) . Prior Medication : Excluded : Other experimental therapy ( e.g. , macrolide antibiotic , paromomycin ) within 30 day prior study entry .
